author: A. Starr
text:
Be careful when doing business via this website.
They have a threshold of how much you can sell, and when this limit is reached (and they can't say how much is the limit), they only release the payments (of items you already sold!) to your bank account IF you give them ALL information they demand, such as a copy of your passport/ID card, etc.

So if you are not willing to give copies of your documents, do not sell via Vinted.
Also, there are fake messages being sent to you requesting you to send documents to them.

These fake messages look EXACTLY the same as messages from customer support, so be aware, is possible that you will be scammed very easily and without even noticing.

I sold 4 items via Vinted and it went well regarding the buyers and their payment to Vinted. 
It did not go well with Vinted paying me, since I am not willing to disclose my passport to them. So they have almost 600, Euros that belong to my last sale (a purse) in their possession. I am contacting my lawyer to dispute this and I will no longer use this website.

So my final tip is: take the time to READ ALL their CONDITIONS before you make the effort/lose the time to list your items in there - you might sell, ship your merchandise and be left empty handed.
title: Be careful when doing business via Vinted

author: ES Carter
text:
I've been buying/selling on Vinted for about 6 months. I had over 400 5 star reviews from buyers and sellers.
I stuck to the rules. I thought it was a good place to sell even though it can take ages to get your money from a buyer and if you receive something tatty/damaged/fake it can take Vinted ages to resolve despite them charging buyers a 'protection fee'.
I always used the money in my Vinted account to buy more things, never once making a withdrawal as it was a way to sell our unwanted things and buy preloved, as Vinted proudly state 'shopping doesn't have to cost the earth'.
That was until my account got blocked today for no valid reason. The automated response for the blocking did not apply to anything I had sold or done on the site and they refused my right to appeal.
They've also STOLEN all the monies I had in my Vinted account and I cannot access any of the transactions where I am waiting for things to arrive that I have bought, so I will have had around £250+ stolen from me in total by Vinted. THIS IS THEFT plain and simple. I will be contacting Citizen's Advice regarding this in the UK. I cannot see, after having read so many awful experiences and stolen monies via Vinted, how they can continue to get away with this.
title: BEWARE. I wish I'd checked reviews before using. Don't get sucked in by their advertising.

author: Scam Alert
text:
I bought some shoes from Vinted & was in London travelling when they arrived (seller sent 10 days late so I couldn't guarantee being at home at the time). 

As I opened the box, I could instantly tell they were not authentic.

I contacted Vinted and said that since the shoes were delivered for 2+ days, they couldn't do anything about it and that I should contact the seller for a refund.

I contacted the seller about the authenticity of the shoes and they deleted the account!!

I told Vinted about this and said they couldn't help and said I should sell the fake shoes back on the app!!

This is awful service and I demand a refund. I took the shoes to a Nike Store and after a while they confirmed that the shoes are indeed counterfeits!

It is illegal to sell or condone the sales of Counterfeit shoes. Vinted were adamant they were real. Very very bad company - avoid!
title: Counterfeit Shoes!!!!

author: Blu Lanna
text: I thought I would give it a go but wish I had checked the reviews first. As a seller please just don’t do it, I’ve only been on there two days and sold two items and I got a message this morning saying my account was blocked fourth fraudulent activity. Believe all of these negative reviews on trust pilot and just save yourself the trouble. Now I realise it’s just a scam and they are keeping all of the sellers money. I can’t imagine how much they are making from people, because all they have to do is block your account and you can no longer gain access to the money you made! Fraudulent and disgusting. The worrying thing is they have all of your details, your name, your address, your bank info so literally they can do anything! I’m going to get in touch with the citizens advice bureau and I advise everyone to check their credit score after using the vinted app!
title: Simply avoid it.
